data.title: Great sandwiches!
data.text: Great little Mom & Pop place, seemed family-operated. great sandwiches, very fresh ingredients, great bread, very friendly. Outside seating if you have a pup very convenient. would definitely try it again next time we're in town.

data.title: Great little independent sandwich place
data.text: The service was great, the sandwiches were delicious.  They use premium quality meats.  A "baby cookie" was included with our lunches.  Nice surprise.  Great place for people watching as it is on the Circle.

data.title: Street side tables, tasty sandwiches
data.text: Order at the counter, staff not overly friendly, but sandwiches good.  They have Panini and traditional sandwiches including BLT, Turkey, Black Forest Ham.  The tables are outside4 only in the south west corner of the Orange Plaza.  I had to ask to have the table cleaned, which was done, but not happily. I enjoyed the roast turkey, cranberry sandwich on a sunny afternoon.  Easy in and out here, quick bite to eat, but the outside tables give you a ringside seat on the Orange Plaza.in a

data.title: Just lunch
data.text: Great stop for lunch. Fresh meat & bread. Sandwiches come with a side & cookie. Owner is nice & there is lots of outside seating.

data.title: Extraordinarily AVERAGE....
data.text:
A very casual (dining) establishment featuring counter ordering followed by delivery of one's food to outdoor tabling.  Simple summation yields the most mediocre of dining experiences featuring soups, salads and sandwiches all certainly unexceptional....

Decidedly not worthy of a return engagement.

data.title: Nice little place in old town Orange
data.text: We were looking for a deli to catch a quick bite and found Two's Company.  It's a much healthier & lighter sandwich then your typical deli.  I ordered the turkey & cranberry sandwich and enjoyed it very much.  My husband had a pastrami panini and liked it.  There's a nice eating area outside with tables w/umbrellas.

data.title: Even two's a crowd at this tiny boutique sandwich shop
data.text:
Due to its genuinely quaint hole-in-the-wall entrance and tiny ordering area, Two's Company is likely to be missed by many strollers due to its back-from-the-sidewalk layout.  There are plenty of shaded tables outside and a few "rub elbows" counter stools within.  But its all you need for a quick but delicious lunch served by a very friendly little staff that knows how to handle the lunch crunch.  There's no dedicated parking except in nearby off-street lots.  You might want to check Google Maps' street view beforehand to get a handle on what to look for if its your first time. 

I had an early lunch featuring a delicious roast turkey, melted provolone and cranberry sauce sandwich on grilled pannini with a side of mustard potato salad, washed down with iced tea, all in trendy "boutique" style, opposite of the usual fast food fare.  If you are still hungry, you won't be able to resist their ice cream selection to top off your meal.  Be sure to tip the hard-working ladies; they deserve it.  If the weather is suitable, sit outside and enjoy the ambience of Old Orange's typically Californian town square, which in this "square peg-round hole" case is probably the oldest traffic circle in the State.  You'll see it on Google Maps.  Enjoy!  I recommend Two's Company if you are on foot in Old Orange.

data.title: Great Sandwiches!
data.text: This is a cute little place (and it is little...very small inside) but it has a nice outdoor seating area with umbrellas and its right on the circle in the City of Orange.  I had a veggie sandwich and it was delicious.  The bread was really really fresh.  And the potato salad is excellent.  I don't usually order potato salad out because it's usually that runny store bought stuff.  But this must be homemade because it was yummy!  If you are cruising around the circle in Orange, this is a good place to stop for lunch!

data.title: For a little hole in the wall, it is pretty nice, really.
data.text: It is so small that there is no seating inside - but they make great use of the larger sidewalk area in front, with lots of little round tables with umbrellas. This is the place to go if you are strolling around Old Towne and want to have a tasty salad or sandwich without making a big lunch production out of it. It is right in the Plaza itself, lending it to a wonderful view of the park-like setting of the Plaza fountain and all the trees. Very reasonable prices, and - as a little sweet gift to you - you get a tiny freshly baked chocolate chip cookie to top it off!
